page.title: 14The D Road
page.content: Mrs.Nichols has lived in Stoke-on-Trent for seventeen years.While she was resident in North Street a major D.Road was built nearby.We asked Mrs Nichols about the D.Road.While the D.Road was being built the surrounding area became dirty.A railway yard,and a canal were demolished to make way for this road. At the time there were no other major roads in Stoke-on-Trent, so the D road was a breakthrough. To Mrs. Nichols herself the D-road had no effect on her life. It didn't help employment because there were people from another part of the country working on it. Another family moved because of the road's loud noise. So there were a lot of mixed opinions about the D Road. The D Road was named Queensway to mark the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.
